projectInfo.title: Industrial Manufacturing As a sErvice STRategies and models for flexible, resilient, and reconfigurable value networks through Trusted and Transparent Operations.
projectInfo.startDate: First day of the month following the entry into force date

coordinator.name: CEFRIEL SOCIETA CONSORTILE A RESPONSABILITA LIMITATA (CEFRIEL)

projectInfo.summary: Manufacturing industry faces the challenges of driving competitiveness, resilience, sustainability and circularity in the context of a Volatile, Uncertain, Complex and Ambiguous environment. A VUCA world calls for new capabilities on the manufacturing systems demanding HUMANufacturing systemsto evolve from industrial automation towardsindustrial autonomy. MaaS technologiesstill lack a solid foundation for more active resilience mechanisms that can respond with increased agility to more volatile and uncertainty scenarios. M4ESTRO envisions to create an end-to-end trustworthy and transparent platform for Manufacturing as a Service offering active and predictive resilience and timely preparedness to disruptive events. M4ESTRO will foster an interactive, collaborative, and dynamic ecosystem where these stakeholders will operate in a hyper-distributed way to manufacture products by providing and receiving services in a secure and trusted manner. It will offer response actions to foreseen risk based on the intrinsic network’s flexibility while offer preparedness to unforeseen risks based on the documented resilience to switch action plans To do so, M4ESTRO will focus on four (4) pillars, offering HW and SW components: Pillar 1: Resilient, transparent and flexible manufacturing processes in value chains. Pillar 2: Resilient equipment, AI and trusted data for adaptive manufacturing. Pillar 3: Resilient Simulations to the Industrial Metaverse for responsive manufacturing. Pillar 4: Human centred Manufacturing Resilience and Sustainability. The impact of M4ESTRO for the European Manufacturing industry, but also the society itself, can be summarised in the following (with a horizon of 4 years after project ends): (i) Process ramp-up time (>26%); (ii) OEE (>14%); (iii) Yield & CpK (>11% & >24%); (iv) Product cost reduction (>9%); (v) Cost per piece (>38%); (vi) Energy consumption (>26%); (vii) about 305 new jobs created and (viii) over 42.89 MEUR ROI for the consortium.
projectInfo.participantsIntro: A diverse consortium of 17 partners from 7 countries, including research institutes, universities, and private companies, collaborating to achieve the project's ambitious goals.

timelineEvents.description: Kick-off and official start of the M4ESTRO project.

Final project activities and submission of the Final Report.

workPackagesWithTasks.title: Resilient, transparent and flexible manufacturing processes in value chains

tasks.title: Sensing and Predicting Indicators of external disruptions in Supply Chains
Resilient chains from reconfiguration models swiftly adapted on logistics and stock level status
Internal availability, distributed capacity, capability, and resources registry
AI-optimised manufacturing networks and resilience predictor
Scoreboard analyser of value chain factors for stakeholder Transparency
Dynamic value chain execution engine and resources allocation

workPackagesWithTasks.title: Resilient equipment, AI and trusted data for adaptive manufacturing

tasks.title: RAMI4.0 Industrial strategies against unexpected disruptions
M4ESTRO platform & trusted real-time semantic data infrastructures
Distributed computing continuum in federated cloud (DPP, Digital Fabric, Digital Thread)
Dynamic Service Level Agreements and Contract processes for trusted manufacturing services
Distributed trust and collective Intelligence from uncertain, incomplete and extreme sensitive data

workPackagesWithTasks.title: Resilient Simulations to the Industrial Metaverse for responsive manufacturing

tasks.title: Capability models verification and conversion into digital twins based on AAS
Hybrid Digital Twins for MaaS demand and supply mediation
Enhancement of resilient simulators with real-time OT/IT data
Multi-actor simulations for resilient, automated and sustainable manufacturing
Dynamic factory networks with self-evolving semantics

workPackagesWithTasks.title: Human centered Manufacturing Resilience and Sustainability

tasks.title: Multi-level, Trusted, Human-Centric and Explainable-DSS
ESGs indexes from selected manufacturing services
Natural Language Processing supported chatbot for explainability
Training nuggets for optimised platform utilisation and for meaningful reactions to disruptions
Business development roadmap for green value networking of MaaS

workPackagesWithTasks.title: Testing and Validation in demo cases

tasks.title: Pilot Sites Preparation
Integration and validation of technologies
Use cases Systems Demonstration and Pilot Operation
Evaluation, transferability, upscaling of M4ESTRO

workPackagesWithTasks.title: Communication, Dissemination, Standardisation, Exploitation and Training

Standards, Clusters and Associations

deliverables.name: AI optimised manufacturing predictor with dynamic Scoreboards
Decentralised learning techniques for supply chain resilience

milestones.name: Framework for resilient and flexi-ble manufacturing value chain available

Hybrid twins and the industrial metaverse simulate reality
